qas.question: What shape do grapes usually resemble?
What type of food are grapes?
How many grapes are generally in a cluster?

context: Grapes are a type of <a3_0>fruit<a3_0/> that grow in clusters of <a4_0>15 to 300<a4_0/>, and can be crimson, black, dark blue, yellow, green, orange, and pink. "White" grapes are actually <a0_0>green<a0_0/> in color, and are evolutionarily derived from the purple grape. Mutations in two regulatory genes of white grapes turn off production of <a1_0>anthocyanins<a1_0/>, which are responsible for the color of purple grapes. Anthocyanins and other pigment chemicals of the larger family of polyphenols in purple grapes are responsible for the varying shades of purple in red wines. Grapes are typically an ellipsoid shape resembling a <a2_0>prolate spheroid<a2_0/>.
